lines.text: Tom is as square as the day is long.
Well, Blanford, there's another story for your paper. When you write Fred's obituary, you might as well right one for the whole town too. Those outlaws have just about cleaned us out!
Now, wait a minute Sam. Now, maybe the wagons got away. Maybe the bandits...
That's just wishing and you know it. This will just be like all the others. No sign of the wagons, outlaws or anything else. I'm not blaming you, Sheriff. I just know when I'm licked, that's all.
Miss Judy, you take my advice. When you get hitched, you make Tom take you out of Yellow Creek. That is, unless you want to spend your honeymoon in a ghost town.
[Nugget and Rocky don't want Tom to worry about the hold-up attempt that they fought off]
Say, what were those shots I just heard?
Shots? Oh, ah, just a little target practice.
That's's right, just practicing.
We'll need a better story than that when we tell the sheriff about the dead body down the road.
[Rocky is examining a horse]
Whatja doin?
Lookin' for Frank.
Frank? Kinda mixed up, ain't ya? This is a horse.
I know, but a hard-ridden horse may lead to Frank.
Not so fast, Mr. Blanford. There's a price tag on this
[watch]
What do you mean?
I figure it ought to be worth twenty-five thousand to you.
Why you cheap double-crosser!
Not so cheap. I said twenty-five thousand!
Rocky! I thought you were on your way to Mason City.
I was, but I ran into a detour.
[Nugget examines Rocky's battered face]
Looks like you ran into more than that.
[last lines]
Where's Uncle Nugget? I wanted to say good-bye.
Here I be, all packed and ready.
Ready? Ready for what?
Honeymoon, of course. Why, we're going to have the best ding-danged honeymoon three people ever had!
Don't you think you better put that valise in back?
Oh, yeah!
